sdata.j: ↑仰向↑↓|あおむ↓け|になりなさい。
sdata.e: Turn on your back.

sdata.e: OK, now turn to your right, a little further, a little further... good. Now lie still on your back.

sdata.e: As a boy I used to lie on my back on the grass and look at the white clouds.

sdata.e: Tom lay on his back.

sdata.e: Then she was floating on her back.

sdata.e: I saw an old man fall on his back in the street.

sdata.e: The boy lay on his back, basking in the spring sunshine.

sdata.j: ↑新聞↑↓しんぶん↓によれば、↑少年↑↓しょうねん↓はなぐられて↑意識↑↓いしき↓を↑失↑↓うしな↓い、↑目↑↓め↓を↑閉↑↓と↓じて|あお↑向↑↓む↓け|に↑倒↑↓たお↓れていた。
sdata.e: According to the newspaper, the boy was knocked unconscious and lay on his back with his eyes closed.

sdata.j: ↑診察↑↓しんさつ↓↑台↑↓だい↓に↑仰向↑↓|あおむ↓け|になってください。

sdata.j: ↑暖↑↓あたた↓かい↑日↑↓ひ↓には↑手足↑↓てあし↓を↑伸↑↓の↓ばしたり、↑仰向↑↓|あおむ↓け|になって↑足↑↓あし↓を↑宙↑↓ちゅう↓に↑上↑↓あ↓げたまま↑寝↑↓ね↓ることもある。
sdata.e: On warm days, bears stretch out or lie on their backs with their feet in the air.

sdata.e: As a boy I used to lie on my back and look at white clouds.

sdata.j: |あお↑向↑↓む↓け|に↑寝↑↓ね↓ると、↑舌↑↓した↓やノドチンコがノドの↑奥↑↓おく↓に↑下↑↓さ↓がるため、↑上気↑↓じょうき↓↑道↑↓どう↓が↑塞↑↓ふさ↓がりやすくなります。
sdata.e: If you sleep on your back it's easier for your upper airway to be obstructed because your tongue, uvula, etc. slip towards the back of your throat.

sdata.j: ↑右↑↓みぎ↓からぐるっと↑回↑↓まわ↓って、もっと、もっと、はい、そのまま↑仰向↑↓|あおむ↓け|になってください。
